str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
Of great value, very costly, very precious. From polus and time; extremely valuable.
A pearl. From margaros; a pearl.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A reduplicated and prolonged form of prao; contracted from perao; to traffic, i.e. Dispose of as merchandise or into slavery.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To buy. From agora; properly, to go to market, i.e. to purchase; specially, to redeem.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
